Meaning: Unique identifier for each patient
State in India where the patient is from
Age of the patient in years
Gender of the patient (Male/Female)
Whether the patient has diabetes (1 = Yes, 0 = No)
Whether the patient has high blood pressure (1 = Yes, 0 = No)
Whether the patient is obese (1 = Yes, 0 = No)
Whether the patient smokes (1 = Yes, 0 = No)
Whether the patient consumes alcohol (1 = Yes, 0 = No)
Whether the patient engages in physical activity (1 = Yes, 0 = No)
Quality of the patient?s diet (higher value = better)
Cholesterol level of the patient (mg/dL)
Level of triglycerides (a type of fat) in the blood, measured in mg/dL
Level of Low-Density Lipoprotein (bad cholesterol) in the blood, measured in mg/dL
Level of High-Density Lipoprotein (good cholesterol) in the blood, measured in mg/dL
Systolic blood pressure (upper number)
Diastolic blood pressure (lower number)
Exposure to polluted air (1 = High, 0 = Low)
Family history of heart disease (1 = Yes, 0 = No)
Self-reported stress level on a scale (e.g., 1 to 10)
Access to healthcare facilities (1 = Yes, 0 = No)
Previous history of heart attack (1 = Yes, 0 = No)
Average emergency response time in minutes
Annual income of the patient (in INR)
Whether the patient has health insurance (1 = Yes, 0 = No)
Target variable: risk of heart attack (1 = At risk, 0 = Not at risk)
